name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Atlanta Buckhead

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at this Fairfield Inn because we were attending an event a few streets over in Buckhead. We booked it because it had a great price for the weekend (~$110/night). This property is hands-down the most well-maintained Fairfield that I have ever stayed at (and I frequently stay at Marriott properties!). It sits near the corner of Piedmont & E Paces Ferry. Perfect location that is convenient to Lenox Mall, which is only about a 7 minute drive away. There are several nice cafes and restaurants within walking distance. The property itself has a HUGE parking lot. No scrambling to find a parking space before night falls. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. The lobby was small, but the furnishings were clean and comfortable. The breakfast area was large, and the morning offerings were plentiful. Waffles, danishes, biscuit sandwiches, fruit, cold cereal, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc. This Fairfield has 5 floors and 2 elevators. The rooms are small-ish, but the furnishings were immaculate. The bedding was comfortable, and the shower in the bath had excellent water pressure. The rooms do have long 'hallways' from the room door, so the bed isn't visible when the door is opened. This was kind of wasted space (imho), but only a minor downside to the excellent accommodations. We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: NIcest, cleanest Fairfield Inn so far for me

reviews.text: There is nothing fancy about this hotel except it is is close to alot of excellent restaurants and shopping. Actually, when you park at the hotel, you can walk to all restaurants and Lenox Square Mall located within a five block area. For the hotel itself, it is starting to show some wear, but it was clean and the staff was very friendly. Base on which direction you are traveling, the hotel is very difficult to locate. But once there, free parking is amble. The hotel exercise room required updating as some equipment was boken. If you are looking for some place that is not fancy and you just want to rest your tired body, this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Basic lodging and hard to find

reviews.text: I stayed three nights on a business trip. This Fairfield Inn appeared to have been recently refurbished. The furniture, decorations, and fixtures were in excellent shape. The heating and AC was a typical below-the-window, self-contained unit. It was not especially noisy but I did not run it that much. The cable TV in the room included the extended Comcast lineup (60-70 channels). I did not notice any premium channels. I found the room was relatively quiet, especially considering the location on busy Piedmont Road.
reviews.title: A Very Nice Fairfield Inn

reviews.text: The room includes free, wired Internet access for your laptop computer. The Ethernet cable is provided. An Internet speed test showed approximately 850Kbs for both upload and download. It appeared that wireless Internet was available in the lobby, but I did not test that.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: The location is very convenient to the Buckhead area (north of downtown) and not too far from Lenox Square shopping center. There are several restaurants in the immediate area. Most of the nicer restaurants are mid to upper expensive. More moderate Waffle House and Krystal restaurants are within a block of the hotel.
reviews.title: A bit down to earth
Nicest Fairfield I've ever stayed at
reviews.text: The free parking is more than adequate. The parking lot wraps around the adjacent properties so that some parking places will be 50 to 100 feet away from the front door.

Received special offer via Mariott email. This property is very well maintained. It is located close to Lenox Mall, which is only about a 7 minute drive away. There are several nice cafes (Caribou Caffee) and restaurants within walking distance. Georgia Aquarium is 20 minutes away. The property has ample parking available. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Our two bed room was spacious and very clean. The furnishings were immaculate. The bedding was very comfortable and the shower in the bath had excellent water pressure. Breakfast was so so. We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Nice, clean fair priced and close to the action
Excellent !!!
reviews.text: We booked the Fairfield Suites after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. We stayed here for 2 nights at the start of a trip to a ranch in Madison Georgia. It is within walkng distance of Lennox Square Mall .and the Marta (railway)which takes you to downtown Atlanta.The staff are better than we have found in some 5* hotels across the world - very friendly and helpful, extremely pleasant- brilliant. Parking is good and the hotel is clean, comfy and well positioned for several good restaurants which are within walking distance. Try the Brazilian ( Fogo de Chou ) across the road for the best tasting steak and beef we have had. Atlanta Fish Market ( 2 min drive) is also excellent but book because it gets very busy. Would definately stay there again.

reviews.text: Let's be honest. It's a Fairfiled Inn. It's not the Ritz Carlton and it's not Larry's Motor Lodge. It's pretty much what you expect from a good Fairfield Inn. This one's either fairly new or recently renovated.
reviews.title: Best value in Buckhead

likes.liked: — Location. Not walking distance to much, but a short car ride to the shopping meccas of Buckhead.
likes.disliked: — Nothing to dislike. It was exactly what I expected.

reviews.text: In true national chain form, you'll get the green colored room and a decent continental breakfast. It's the fact that it's in Buckhead and still has Fairfield Inn prices that make this a good pick (and bump it from Average to Above Average in my rating). If you want to stay in luxury, this isn't for you. If you want a good hotel at a fair price in Buckhead, look no more.
reviews.title: Fantastic Fairfield

likes.disliked: — parked under a tree that dripped sap:-0

reviews.text: I was in Buckhead for a 3 day conference and this was one of the suggested places to stay. From my first contact, I was impressed. The entire staff is very harworking and polite. All of the employees spoke to me anytime we passed each other. Parking is ample and there are good breakfast choices. It was kept clean and well stocked. There was an indoor pool which I did not use. I had a king bed and it was very comfortable as were the many pillows I had. I like my room really dark at night and the blackout drapes were excellent. I left the "Do not disturb" sign on my door when I was at my meetings and they even slid a note under the door saying they respected my wishes but to call if I needed anything. The water pressure was awesome...wish I had it at home! I love to read the paper and a USA TODAY was outside my door each AM. There was an issue between my bank and the hotel over the bill and it was resolved swiftly by the hotel (can't remember employee's name who was so helpful...worn out from meetings!) You can't go wrong with this clean, excellent hotel:-)
reviews.title: Great Value at ok location
